channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - US
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.
channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2016 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: Town's residents told not to drink this water for 30 days
4 more charged in Flint water crisis
item.description: Four officials in charge of Flint's water, including two who reported directly to Governor Rick Snyder, have been charged in the fourth round of charges announced by the Michigan Attorney General's Office as it investigates the city's water crisis.

item.title: When brown tap water is deemed legal and safe
item.description: Garrett Boyte's first clue that something was wrong came the day he moved to town.

item.title: How to test for lead in your home water supply
item.description: The water crisis in Flint, Michigan, may have you asking, "Does my home's water contain lead?"

item.title: Soccer player sues UConn over bird-flipping penalty
NYPD names pot of gold theft suspect
item.description: The NYPD is after him and his lucky charms.

item.title: Manchin on WV opioid abuse: 'We need to declare a war on drugs'
item.description: Democratic Sen. Joe Manchin called for a new "war on drugs" Tuesday to combat the opiate crisis striking his state of West Virginia, eagerly adopting the language of the now much-criticized Nixon-era push to curb illicit substance use.

item.title: Aaron Hernandez ID'd as shooter
item.description: A survivor identified imprisoned former New England Patriots player Aaron Hernandez as the person who shot and killed two men inside the same car in which he was riding.

item.title: Obama bans Arctic drilling
item.description: Looking to cement his environmental record, President Barack Obama plans to take new action as early as Tuesday barring offshore drilling in areas of the Arctic and Atlantic oceans, a person familiar with his decision said.

item.title: Ex-cop accused of killing 4
item.description: A retired police officer allegedly caught in a drug deal gone bad was charged with quadruple murder in Orange County, New York, on Monday.

item.title: Merry Christmas: You're fired!
item.description: The Grinch stole Christmas this year for thousands of Americans who were given pink slips before the holidays.

item.title: Why did NC governor strip himself of power?
911 tapes from road rage incident capture grandmother's agony
item.description: The weekend shopping trip wasn't supposed to end like this. One minute, the grandmother of 3-year-old Acen King steered them toward the JC Penney in Little Rock, Arkansas. The next, the boy was fatally shot in the seat of her maroon Dodge Charger.

item.title: NBA star vows to help hometown, but admits he can't do it alone
item.description: The Uber driver turned toward me with a look of genuine concern when she confirmed our destination, East 58th Street and South King Drive, and exclaimed, "That is NOT a good area!"

item.title: Half of US workers still have vacation days
Teen rides the wild surf 2,000 straight days
item.description: Meg Roh defies many modern-day adult complaints that teens are difficult and unpredictable.

item.title: Trump's still going wrong on Twitter
item.description: When the President-elect speaks, people listen -- and governments, businesses and ordinary citizens scramble to parse, interpret and, given his power, make snap decisions about how to act and respond.

item.title: Female doctors have healthier patients, study suggests
item.description: When a patient goes to the best hospital, he or she usually hopes for a doctor who is knowledgeable and experienced. Something else to wish for? A woman physician.

item.title: Sources: Obama shrinking Guantanamo
item.description: President Barack Obama, in his final month in office, is moving to leave as few prisoners in Guantanamo Bay as possible, notifying Congress that the administration intends to transfer out some of the detainees before Donald Trump is sworn in.

item.title: Meet Trump's potential SEC chairman
Apple AirPods review: Do they actually stay in your ears?
Google and Facebook accused of enabling ISIS
item.description: The families of three victims from the Orlando nightclub shooting filed a lawsuit on Monday against Twitter, Facebook and Google for providing "material support" to ISIS.

item.title: Twin donates hair to brother with cancer
Dog attacked with machete
Sailing club grateful competitors survived
Mayor caught on hot mic
Teen's toy drive honors late brother
ACLU sues jail over pregnancies
Woman sends 10,000+ Christmas cards
